result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael Adam Fermenich in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Adam Fermenich is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Adam Fermenich

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM Defendant Michael Adam Fermenich in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Michael Adam Fermenich.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf for Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to Count 1 and Count 3 in 22CM263. Count 2 in 22CM263 and 22CM293 to be dismissed but read in. For Count 1 in 22CM263- 120 days jail with credit of 42 days. Huber for work if employed and pay mandatory court costs. For Count 3 in 22CM263, 90 days jail concurrent with Count 1. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Nelsen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 1 in 22CM263, 120 days jail with credit of 42 days. Huber for work if employed and pay mandatory court costs. For Count 3 in 22CM263, 90 days jail with credit of 42 days, concurrent with Count 1.
No contact with CCS, AJS, or 1101 North 17th Street, Superior, WI

1:41 PM Defendant Michael Adam Fermenich appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. No appearance by Attorney Lance Nelson. Court has attempted to contact Mr. Nelson with no response. No further information. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant indicates will retain lawyer.  Court enters pleas of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defendant indicates he is homeless. Address is general delivery. 
State requests $1500 cash, no contact with CCS, AJS, or 1101 North 17th Street, Superior, WI. Indicates has pending case where bail was posted. Cites prior FTA's. Cites prior cases. 
Defendant indicates has no money to post. 
Court orders $500, with conditions of no contact with CCS, AJS, or 1101 North 17th Street, Superior, WI
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
